abstract: That’s because the cost of health insurance is passed on to employees. “There’s no economist in the world who disagrees with that,” says one conservative expert.
snippet: That’s because the cost of health insurance is passed on to employees. “There’s no economist in the world who disagrees with that,” says one conservative expert.
lead_paragraph: Agenda readers were, well, skeptical when we highlighted a radio story showing that, so far at least, a recent play-or-pay mandate for employers in San Francisco to provide health coverage hasn’t led to significant job losses. “Thin reporting,” chided “Ted.” “Gabi” suspected that the economist studying the program, U.C. Berkeley’s Will Dow, was sloppy. “I would suspect that the decrease is there alright, but I’m not seeing it; I’d call it measurement error.”

headline.main: Experts Agree: An Employer Mandate Doesn’t Cost Many Jobs
